measured_by: single 5-point Likert-scale item (1 = “Not effective at all”, 5 = “Extremely effective”)
justification: “…they were then asked on a five-point Likert scale whether they believe B-12 injections are an effective medical treatment (1 = ‘Not effective at all’, 5 = ‘Extremely effective’).”
construct: Belief in effectiveness of B-12 injections

justification: “First, participants answered a brief questionnaire examining their familiarity with B-12 injections (Yes/No)….”

measured_by: Likert-scale intention item (5-point in Exp 1a; 6-point in Exp 1b/1c)
justification: “…participants were asked how likely it was they would try B-12 injections on a five-point Likert scale.” and “These were changed from a five-point Likert scale to a six-point Likert scale…”
construct: Likelihood of trying B-12 injections oneself

justification: “…they were asked how likely they were to give B-12 injections to their child (if applicable).”
construct: Likelihood of giving B-12 injections to one’s child

justification: “…participants were then asked on a five-point Likert scale whether they believe these were effective preventative health treatments (1 = ‘Not effective at all’, 5 = ‘Extremely effective’).”
construct: Belief in effectiveness of HPV test, epidural, and hormonal IUD

justification: “After the trial, participants answered questions to test how effective they thought the medical treatments are and whether they would try them themselves or recommend someone they know to try them.”
construct: Likelihood of trying or recommending reproductive health treatments
